verses.text: The word that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spake against Babylon \add and\add* against the land of the Chaldeans by Jeremiah the prophet.\f + \fr 50.1 \ft by…: Heb. by the hand of Jeremiah\f*

Declare ye among the nations , and publish , and set up a standard ; publish , \add and\add* conceal not: say , Babylon is taken , Bel is confounded , Merodach is broken in pieces ; her idols are confounded , her images are broken in pieces.\f + \fr 50.2 \ft set up: Heb. lift up\f*
For out of the north there cometh up a nation against her, which shall make her land desolate , and none shall dwell therein: they shall remove , they shall depart , both man and beast. \p

¶ In those days , and in that time , saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, the children of Israel shall come , they and the children of Judah together , going and weeping : they shall go , and seek the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* their God.

They shall ask the way to Zion with their faces thitherward , \add saying\add*, Come , and let us join ourselves to the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* in a perpetual covenant \add that\add* shall not be forgotten.

My people hath been lost sheep : their shepherds have caused them to go astray , they have turned them away \add on\add* the mountains : they have gone from mountain to hill , they have forgotten their restingplace.\f + \fr 50.6 \ft restingplace: Heb. place to lie down in\f*

All that found them have devoured them: and their adversaries said , We offend not, because they have sinned against the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, the habitation of justice , even the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, the hope of their fathers.
Remove out of the midst of Babylon , and go forth out of the land of the Chaldeans , and be as the he goats before the flocks. \p

¶ For, lo, I will raise and cause to come up against Babylon an assembly of great nations from the north country : and they shall set themselves in array against her; from thence she shall be taken : their arrows \add shall be\add* as of a mighty expert man ; none shall return in vain.\f + \fr 50.9 \ft expert…: or, destroyer\f*
And Chaldea shall be a spoil : all that spoil her shall be satisfied , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

Because ye were glad , because ye rejoiced , O ye destroyers of mine heritage , because ye are grown fat as the heifer at grass , and bellow as bulls ;\f + \fr 50.11 \ft fat: Heb. big, or, corpulent\f*\f + \fr 50.11 \ft bellow…: or, neigh as steeds\f*
Your mother shall be sore confounded ; she that bare you shall be ashamed : behold, the hindermost of the nations \add shall be\add* a wilderness , a dry land , and a desert.

Because of the wrath of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* it shall not be inhabited , but it shall be wholly desolate : every one that goeth by Babylon shall be astonished , and hiss at all her plagues.
Put yourselves in array against Babylon round about : all ye that bend the bow , shoot at her, spare no arrows : for she hath sinned against the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

Shout against her round about : she hath given her hand : her foundations are fallen , her walls are thrown down : for it \add is\add* the vengeance of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: take vengeance upon her; as she hath done , do unto her.

Cut off the sower from Babylon , and him that handleth the sickle in the time of harvest : for fear of the oppressing sword they shall turn every one to his people , and they shall flee every one to his own land.\f + \fr 50.16 \ft sickle: or, scythe\f* \p
¶ Israel \add is\add* a scattered sheep ; the lions have driven \add him\add* away : first the king of Assyria hath devoured him; and last this Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon hath broken his bones.
Therefore thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts , the God of Israel ; Behold, I will punish the king of Babylon and his land , as I have punished the king of Assyria.
And I will bring Israel again to his habitation , and he shall feed on Carmel and Bashan , and his soul shall be satisfied upon mount Ephraim and Gilead.

In those days , and in that time , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, the iniquity of Israel shall be sought for , and \add there shall be\add* none; and the sins of Judah , and they shall not be found : for I will pardon them whom I reserve. \p

¶ Go up against the land of Merathaim , \add even\add* against it, and against the inhabitants of Pekod : waste and utterly destroy after them, saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and do according to all that I have commanded thee.\f + \fr 50.21 \ft of Merathaim: or, of the rebels\f*\f + \fr 50.21 \ft Pekod: or, Visitation\f*
A sound of battle \add is\add* in the land , and of great destruction.
How is the hammer of the whole earth cut asunder and broken ! how is Babylon become a desolation among the nations !

I have laid a snare for thee, and thou art also taken , O Babylon , and thou wast not aware : thou art found , and also caught , because thou hast striven against the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

The 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* hath opened his armoury , and hath brought forth the weapons of his indignation : for this \add is\add* the work of the Lord 
d \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*
d* of hosts in the land of the Chaldeans.

Come against her from the utmost border , open her storehouses : cast her up as heaps , and destroy her utterly : let nothing of her be left.\f + \fr 50.26 \ft from…: Heb. from the end\f*\f + \fr 50.26 \ft cast…: or, tread her\f*
Slay all her bullocks ; let them go down to the slaughter : woe unto them! for their day is come , the time of their visitation.
The voice of them that flee and escape out of the land of Babylon , to declare in Zion the vengeance of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* our God , the vengeance of his temple.

Call together the archers against Babylon : all ye that bend the bow , camp against it round about ; let none thereof escape : recompense her according to her work ; according to all that she hath done , do unto her: for she hath been proud against the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, against the Holy One of Israel.
Therefore shall her young men fall in the streets , and all her men of war shall be cut off in that day , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

Behold, I \add am\add* against thee, \add O thou\add* most proud , saith the Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd* of hosts : for thy day is come , the time \add that\add* I will visit thee.\f + \fr 50.31 \ft most…: Heb. pride\f*
And the most proud shall stumble and fall , and none shall raise him up : and I will kindle a fire in his cities , and it shall devour all round about him.\f + \fr 50.32 \ft the…: Heb. pride\f* \p

¶ Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts ; The children of Israel and the children of Judah \add were\add* oppressed together : and all that took them captives held them fast ; they refused to let them go.

Their Redeemer \add is\add* strong ; the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts \add is\add* his name : he shall throughly plead their cause , that he may give rest to the land , and disquiet the inhabitants of Babylon. \p
¶ A sword \add is\add* upon the Chaldeans , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and upon the inhabitants of Babylon , and upon her princes , and upon her wise \add men\add*.
A sword \add is\add* upon the liars ; and they shall dote : a sword \add is\add* upon her mighty men ; and they shall be dismayed.\f + \fr 50.36 \ft liars: or, chief stays: Heb. bars\f*

A sword \add is\add* upon their horses , and upon their chariots , and upon all the mingled people that \add are\add* in the midst of her; and they shall become as women : a sword \add is\add* upon her treasures ; and they shall be robbed.
A drought \add is\add* upon her waters ; and they shall be dried up : for it \add is\add* the land of graven images , and they are mad upon \add their\add* idols.

Therefore the wild beasts of the desert with the wild beasts of the islands shall dwell \add there\add*, and the owls shall dwell therein: and it shall be no more inhabited for ever ; neither shall it be dwelt in from generation to generation.

As God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah and the neighbour \add cities\add* thereof, saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; \add so\add* shall no man abide there, neither shall any son of man dwell therein.
Behold, a people shall come from the north , and a great nation , and many kings shall be raised up from the coasts of the earth.

They shall hold the bow and the lance : they \add are\add* cruel , and will not shew mercy : their voice shall roar like the sea , and they shall ride upon horses , \add every one\add* put in array , like a man to the battle , against thee, O daughter of Babylon.
The king of Babylon hath heard the report of them, and his hands waxed feeble : anguish took hold of him, \add and\add* pangs as of a woman in travail.

Behold, he shall come up like a lion from the swelling of Jordan unto the habitation of the strong : but I will make them suddenly run away from her: and who \add is\add* a chosen \add man, that\add* I may appoint over her? for who \add is\add* like me? and who will appoint me the time ? and who \add is\add* that shepherd that will stand before me?\f + \fr 50.44 \ft appoint me…: or, convent me to plead?\f*

Therefore hear ye the counsel of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, that he hath taken against Babylon ; and his purposes , that he hath purposed against the land of the Chaldeans : Surely the least of the flock shall draw them out : surely he shall make \add their\add* habitation desolate with them.
At the noise of the taking of Babylon the earth is moved , and the cry is heard among the nations.
